intro: Euhaynaldia uranocoma, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Euhaynaldia uranocoma is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
